headline: Why AutoZone (AZO) Is Down 9.7% After Earnings Fell Despite Higher Sales And What's Next
summary: AutoZone recently reported fiscal first-quarter 2026 results showing net sales of US$4,628.63 million, up from US$4,279.64 million a year earlier, while net income fell to US$530.82 million and diluted earnings per share from continuing operations declined to US$31.04. Behind the headline miss, management pointed to a US$98 million non-cash LIFO inventory charge, tariff-related cost pressures, and higher expenses from opening 53 new stores and upgrading the supply chain, factors that weighed...
